getFileName

public static java.lang.String getFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
Get the filename part of a potentially complex filename that might incldue a path. Strip the path part and return the file name.

Parameters:
fileName - Either a simple file name or a file name that includes a path part.
Returns:
The file name without the path.

getHomeSubDir

public static java.lang.String getHomeSubDir(java.lang.String subDir)

Get the name of and ensure the existance of a subdirectory of the users home directory.

For instance, getHomeSubDir("Elvenare") might return:

/home/ccalvert/elvenware

Parameters:
subDir - directory you want to create or confirm the existence of
Returns:
The new directory name

findFiles

public static final void findFiles(java.lang.String dirName,
                                   java.lang.String extFilter,
                                   java.util.ArrayList list,
                                   boolean includeDirs,
                                   boolean prependDirName)
Find all the files in a given directory and subdirectories

Parameters:
dirName - The directory to search
extFilter - An extension filter such as ".java". null for no filter
list - The files will be returned in this array
prependDirName - Return relative file names, or give full path

findFiles

public static void findFiles(java.lang.String dirName,
                             java.util.ArrayList list,
                             java.lang.String ext)
Find all the files in a directory with a particular extension. Example: ArrayList list = new ArrayList(); findFiles("g:/utils/classes/", list, ".jar");

Parameters:
dirName - The directory to search
list - The list to hold the files
ext - The extension to filter on in the form ".jar"

findDirectories

public static java.util.ArrayList findDirectories(java.lang.String dirName)
Find all the files in a directory with a particular extension. Example: ArrayList list = new ArrayList(); findFiles("g:/utils/classes/", list, ".jar");

Parameters:
dirName - The directory to search

zipDirectory

public static void zipDirectory(java.lang.String dir,
                                java.lang.String zipFileName)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Zip up a directory and save its contents. Does not zip up nested directories.

Parameters:
dir - The directory you want to zip up
zipFileName - The name of the zip file you want to create
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

zipFiles

public static void zipFiles(java.lang.String zipName,
                            java.lang.String[] files)
Zip a set of files into a single zip archive. The names of the files are passed in the files array, and the name of the zip file is placed in the zipName variable.

Parameters:
zipName - name of the archive to create
files - A list of files to zip up.
